articles.description: Raheem Sterling's double against Luton helps Chelsea claim their first Premier League win under manager Mauricio Pochettino.
articles.title: Sterling double helps Chelsea see off Luton

articles.description: Jenni Hermoso says she did not consent to be kissed by Spanish FA president Luis Rubiales - as 81 players say they will not play for Spain until he leaves.
articles.title: Hermoso 'didn't consent' as players refuse to play

articles.description: American Noah Lyles completes a sensational sprint double at the World Championships as Zharnel Hughes misses out on a 200m medal.
articles.title: Hughes misses out as Lyles completes golden double

articles.description: Heavyweight Robert Helenius returns an "adverse analytical finding" following a voluntary drug test before his bout with Anthony Joshua, Matchroom Boxing says.
articles.title: Helenius drug test returns 'adverse finding'

articles.description: Watch as Jamaica's Shericka Jackson runs a championship record of 21.41 seconds - the second fastest time in history - to win gold in the 200m final at the World Athletics Championships.
articles.title: Jackson runs second-fastest 200m in history to win gold

articles.description: McLaren's Lando Norris heads Red Bull's Max Verstappen in second practice at the Dutch Grand Prix.
articles.title: Norris heads Verstappen at Dutch GP second practice

articles.description: New Zealand second row Scott Barrett is sent off as South Africa register their biggest win over the All Blacks, scoring five tries at Twickenham.
articles.title: Springboks record biggest win over All Blacks

articles.description: Watch as Noah Lyles completes the sprint double by adding the 200m title to his 100m crown, winning the final in 19.52 seconds at the World Athletics Championships.
articles.title: Lyles wins 200m final as Hughes finishes fourth

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag accuses his players of not running enough in their Premier League defeat at Tottenham.
articles.title: Players did not run enough against Spurs - Ten Hag

articles.description: American pole vaulter Katie Moon defends her decision to share gold with Australian Nina Kennedy following social media criticism.
articles.title: Moon defends decision to share pole vault gold
